Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: CKA12
Reviews.Content: The staff seemed nice. The rooms were nice enough and clean , nothing special.. I was thinking I paid $450.00 peso ? and it included a small breakfast on the 7th floor. So I was happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately priced and close to Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: gdenton
Reviews.Content: I paid 610 $M (which came out to about $52 US once I figured out the actual exchange rate including the various transaction fees one is charged by banks etc) March 25 2011. I got a room overlooking the street below with 3 sets of windows. Bathroom was good, Bed was good. There were some weird rooms in the back areas with windows onto the stairwell that looked like they were inhabited by European backpackers that looked really nasty--rest assured there are nicer rooms if you are shown one of those. Basically I got a decent room in about the best possible location in Mexico City for the price one would pay for a lousy motel 6 in East Nowhere USA. When I look at it that way I cannot believe anyone would ever complain. The place is safe if you are not in one of the skanky rooms--advice-don't stay in a skanky room. The staff was average-not particularly friendly but not rude. Mostly young kids who spend alot of time texting their friends. One great benefit is the restaurant below which makes pretty darn good tortas and licuados when you need a little pick me up for very reasonable prices ($10 for two huge sandwiches and two giant fresh fruit drinks.) Of course the taco stands are even cheaper but hey I just walked down stairs and grabbed my food in no time. Less than half the price of the Hampton Inn around the corner and about 2/3 as nice so good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Anne M
Reviews.Content: Rooms very small and smelly, window loooking into other rooms. Beds tinny and very uncomfortable. Bathroom very old, not nice at all. Wouldn't stay again. Cockroaches in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: alex_tripper
Reviews.Content: First I have to say the location is great! Just a few (about 2 or 3) blocks from the Zocalo. I've been several times in Mexico City and I wouln't mind to return to this hotel. Located at one of the main streets of historical center, is minutes away from everything. I had to call to make the reservation because I didn't get an answer from them by e-mail.The bed was kind of hard and the pillows were kind of thin, but if you are like me and walk around the city all day long, it won't be a problem (you'll be too tired to notice it). We changed our room because the first one was too small, the staff kindly took care of changing all our stuff and everything was there.Advertising says free breakfast included, but I would recommend to have it somewhere else. The hotel's "restaurant" is at the top floor and it is too small for all the guests. This hotel is not the Ritz, but it is a nice place to have a sleep and rest. I would recommend this hotel for people in a tight budget looking for a place to rest at nights.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately Priced Hotel in The Center”
Reviews.Author: David I
Reviews.Content: When I visited Hotel Canada and spent $445 pesos for one night, on a Saturday. It's not a bad price, but there are many other hotels in the area for half of the price of this one. The room itself was pretty comfortable. The walls are paper thin. I could hear the ladies in other room talk for a few hours as well as someone else consummating their relationship. Other than being double the price and the walls being thin, the hotel was up to my standards. Note: When I stayed, I was given a voucher for a free breakfast. I was a little impatient but the dining area wasn't very large making the wait time go up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: RobTor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in Feb 2010. The room was small, but clean and everything was in good shape. The shower was excellent with lots of hot water. We were on the 5th floor with a great view over the street. We were not bothered by street noise. A good breakfast is included and made to order. The serving staff are unfriendly and curt (except for Jonathan), but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but didn't get along with the cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: creative2010
Reviews.Content: I'm used of cockroaches in Mexico but I couldn't sleep in bedroom where we saw more than 5 of them during the day within a short time span. Granted our friend's room seem to be just fine. We tried to switch rooms, but we saw another one in another room. So we decided to switch hotels to get a good night sleep. The Hotel Canada staff were cool about it and gave us a full refund. So overall, if you're looking for a hotel with a great location, extremely affordable, no frills and don't mind roaches than this is your place to stay. But I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, but Small and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Don_Cuevas
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in January on our way home from Oaxaca. The staff is warm and welcoming, and the desk personnel speak English. We had Room 613, I believe, a very small corner room on the top floor of rooms (only the breakfast room is on a higher floor). It was simple, with a king bed, with large windows on two sides. It was a little tricky maneuvering around the bed and especially, the TV set on the overhead shelf. There was a lot of street noise, as one would expect from the location on one of the Centro's busiest intersections. (That's why we carry earplugs.) I'm quite sure we paid over $600 pesos, so except for the location, it's no bargain. Breakfast was included as an additional option. At first we opted out, with myriad restaurants closeby, but as my wife had a bad cold, and I a lesser one, it was easier to stay in the hotel and have what turned out to be a very nice breakfast in the sunny breakfast dining room. (The excellent Jugos CanadÃ¡ is next door; CafÃ© El Popular, almost across the street, and CafÃ© La Blanca about a block west, among others recommended.) The advertised wi-fi didn't work in the room, but the friendly receptionist set me up with a cable to hook me up in the lobby area. (This is a common problem with several Mexican hotels in which we've stayed. The wi-fi is advertised as a "service" but often doesn't work.) So, my impressions of the hotel may be clouded somewhat by the fact that both of us arrived tire and with colds. The location is unbeatable if you want to be in the very center of the historic part of the city. There are countless restaurants and shops of all descriptions within easy walking distance. Now I can compare the Hotel CanadÃ¡ with the larger and much more spacious Hotel Gillow nearby, where we stayed in September, 2008 (see review). The prices are similar but the Gillow gives much more space and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “People stay away from this hotel: 200 EUR stolen from the safe !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: viajeroVZ
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS [--] HOTEL !!!! Worst thing that can happen - there is a safe with programmable code in each room, from our in our room were 200 EUR stolen !!!! They operate with unique code that opens all the safes so they can do what they want .The safe was closed but when we opened it was messed up from inside and when we counted the money : 200 EUR was gone!!!!!! We complained to the girls at the front desk,saying that we want to talk to "gerente general" and then the story beggins : first, 2 girls and 1 bell-boy took us to the room and to the other room convincing us (but barely holding the burst of laugh on their faces, unforgetable scene !!!!!) that it isn't possible to open the safe. We said that we want to talk to general manager: the girl says that he is on the large distance and is not able to speak with us !!!! we packed our stuff and left to other hotel! In this one there are plenty of bell-boys in the lobby, really strange,got nothing to do and have a plenty of time to operate in the rooms! it was obvious according to their behaviour that they are well-trained team and you can do nothing ! and they almost laughed at our face!!!! PEOPLE STAY AWAY FORM THIS HOTEL, IT'S A THIEVES PLACE!!! TEN CUIDADO!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: hapitripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night as the next day we fly back home. We paid $56 US for the night including breakfast. For the price, the location was great, a few blocks away from the Zocalo and Catedral. The rooms are a little small and a bit dark but for one night it was okay. The bathroom didnâ€™t have a divider so you cannot use it while someone is showering or you will get wet. Our main concern was that we couldnâ€™t sleep due to the noise on the first floor. It was echoing and bouncing back on the four walls that the window was facing. We were hearing everything from people talking loud, singing loud, shouting, etc. At 2 am, we had to call the front desk to see if they can check what was going on and maybe get them to keep it low. It took maybe about 15-20 min for the noise to subside. After that we were able to sleep or we just got tired.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Adequate Hotel at a good location and price”
Reviews.Author: TodW
Reviews.Content: I arrived at The Hotel Canada after my confirmed room at the Hotel Catedral was sold to someone else. The staff were welcoming. The room was small but reasonably equipped with door chain, bed, wardrobe, bedside light, safe and ensuite lavatory and shower. You have 30 min a day free use of the Holiday Inn internet along the road. For a traveller on a budget it was fine. I paid a bit under USD50 for B&B the first night, rather less when I returned for a further 2 nights. The hotel is located near the Cathedral in the square (Zocalo) on Calle 5 Mayo, a block further on from the Zocalo Holiday Inn who owns this hotel. An excellent location for exploring the historic area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: vivalaholidays
Reviews.Content: We were recommended a different hotel on Avenue 5 de Mayo, however we found Hotel Canada and never looked back! The rooms are small, but clean and for AUD35 a night including breakfast, it was a great place to rest our heads at night. The staff there were more than happy to help us in any way they could and made our time in Mexico City much better. We hired a driver through the hotel called Eduardo (highly recommend him) and he drove us all around the city for a few days. We had our own private city tour.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am in Mexico quite ofter during the year and have been staying at the Hotel Canada for the past ten years of visits. The staff is friendly, full of information, most of the staff speaks at least some English and are more than willing to help in any way possible to make ones visit to the city a good one. There is a tourist desk located in the hotel that can fix you up with day trips, or longer ones if you desire, at resonable cost. It is an older hotel but has been kept up and is always clean and bright, some of the front rooms do catch some of the traffic noise from the street but not enough to really matter. The rates are great and it is close to many of the major attractions in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Mexico and while in Mexico City I stayed at the Hotel Canada. Just steps away from the Zocalo and many shops, restaurants, Alameda Park and the Palacio de Las Bellas Artes. After one night at another hotel (dark, dank, loud) I found this place (bright, friendly, clean and fairly quiet). For the price ($35 for a single), it was a steal considering the location. I'll definitely stay here my next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel canada”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: im in mexico once in a year. everytime i stay first in hotel canada. its very nice, its clean, its near the zocalo in the 5 de mayo mexico d.f. in the hotel there is a bar with many juice, fresh and delicius and cheap. service and information in the hotel is very good. the people are very friendly. special the concierge. ( a very fine man) in march 2003 i go back to mexico city, ans i promise i come back to hotel canada. angela from germany
